body_html:
Just to be more precise and maybe help people who are looking for a solution:

The proposal/request in this thread is for something similar to tf.QueueBase.from_list, but receiving dequeue operations and/or the output of tf.train.batch instead of Queue objects. If one has manual control over the Queues, it is possible to use this method to pick which queue we should dequeue from using a single input variable. Without access to the Queue objects (as when using tf.train.batch), this is not possible.

Maybe it's possible to hack our way through the issue by retrieving the Queue objects from the graph and calling tf.QueueBase.from_list with them, but this would not be a clean solution.

body:
Just to be more precise and maybe help people who are looking for a solution:

The proposal/request in this thread is for something similar to `tf.QueueBase.from_list`, but receiving `dequeue` operations and/or the output of `tf.train.batch` instead of Queue objects. If one has manual control over the Queues, it is possible to use this method to pick which queue we should dequeue from using a single input variable. Without access to the Queue objects (as when using `tf.train.batch`), this is not possible.

_Maybe_ it's possible to _hack_ our way through the issue by retrieving the Queue objects from the graph and calling `tf.QueueBase.from_list` with them, but this would not be a clean solution.
